definitions.definition: A characteristic or manner of an interaction; a behavior.
definitions.example: Watch the dynamic between the husband and wife when they disagree.
The study of fluid dynamics quantifies turbulent and laminar flows.

definitions.definition: The varying loudness or volume of a song or the markings that indicate the loudness.
definitions.example: If you pay attention to the dynamics as you play, it's a very moving piece.

definitions.definition: A symbol in a musical score that indicates the desired level of volume.
(grammar) A verb that indicates continued or progressive action on the part of the subject.

definitions.example: The environment is dynamic, changing with the years and the seasons.
He was a dynamic and engaging speaker.

definitions.definition: Having to do with the volume of sound.
definitions.example: The dynamic marking in bar 40 is forte.

definitions.definition: Happening at runtime instead of being predetermined at compile time.
Pertaining to dynamics, the branch of mechanics concerned with the effects of forces on the motion of objects.
(grammar) Of a verb: not stative, but fientive; indicating continued or progressive action on the part of the subject.
